pull.title: Don't announce to non-peer CNodes
pull.body:
This is a very minor bug: we tried to send out a "version" message in CNode's constructor, which meant also for pnodeLocalHost, causing a "socket send error 9" under Linux or "socket send error 10038" in Windows.

Fixes #2587

events.body: @TheBlueMatt is there a problem with pulltester here?

@sipa Looks like this is the cause but perhaps just related to some pulltester work.
`Blocks which should/should not have been accepted but weren't/were: 9`
ACK, I can confirm this fixes #2587.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/788064dd12ab7a7075ad24771f377587ad93b68d for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
